text: a blood-sugar is typically what we check when we identify those who are at risk for diabetes and we do it as a screening test as well generally what we do is we do a finger stick or blood serum

initially the cutoff for a normal glucose was less than 120 but currently the cutoff is less than 95 anyone who's above 95 really classifies as somebody who's at risk for diabetes and those
individuals will actually come in at about 135 to 140 or even higher well those are people who are either at diabetic range or even exceed the range at which they have diabetes which is not
